meanings.definition: A person who embraces someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The two friends were warm embracers, always hugging each other tightly.
meanings.sent2: The mother was a loving embracer, always ready to give her children a hug.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear was an embracer of secrets, keeping all the whispered wishes safe.
meanings.sent4: The cozy blanket was an embracer of warmth on chilly nights.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches were like gentle embracers, providing shade and comfort.

meanings.definition: A group of people who embrace a particular idea or belief.
meanings.sent1: The community was a united group of embracers, all supporting the same cause.
meanings.sent2: The team of scientists were embracers of innovation, always seeking new discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The book club was a lively group of embracers, eager to discuss their favorite stories.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was a gathering of embracers of different genres, celebrating diversity.
meanings.sent5: The school choir was a harmonious group of embracers, singing in perfect unison.
